key_channel_insights.line_content: 84 % of fares match the site; gaps are concentrated in non-Thai points of sale and last-minute shopping.
91 % of metasearch listings are cheaper by an average 8 %, signalling immediate revenue leakage.
Parity has fallen to 76 %; undercuts now 14 % with the sharpest exposure in overseas markets.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 84 % of OTA fares equal website prices, stable week-on-week and only 3 ppts below last month.
OTAs under-price on 7.3 % of itineraries, mainly in non-Thai markets and 0-14-day bookings.
OTA-higher cases doubled to 6 % on long-haul routes, eroding competitiveness on high-yield ODs.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Website fare missing in just 2.5 % of checks; distribution reach remains solid.
Same-price share at 84.2 % is down 2.6 ppts month-over-month; monitor for further slide.
OTA-lower share fell 1.1 ppt WoW to 7.3 %, yet levels stay 2.9 ppts above last month.
OTA-higher occurrences rose to 6 %, broadly in line with the monthly average.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 91 %; no undercuts; OTA premiums 6 % and growing.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity 92 %; undercuts 3.2 % (×4 MoM) but still low in absolute terms.
Parity just 54 %; undercuts 22 %, premiums 21 %—largest dispersion hotspot.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity 80 %; undercuts 9.8 %, premiums 6.3 %—widest swings for urgent travel.
Parity 92 %; undercuts 2.7 % (-2.8 ppts WoW); premiums up to 5.3 %.

mse_highlights.line_content: 91.7 % of itineraries cheaper on MSE, average 8 % discount.
‘MSE Lower’ share jumped 20 ppts month-over-month; parity shrank to 6.6 %.
Website offer missing in only 0.7 % of searches; issue is price, not presence.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 0.7 % of OD pairs lack a website fare on MSE.
Exact-match fares down to 6.6 % (-20 ppts MoM).
MSE lower on 91.7 % of checks, discount 8 %; risk intensifying week-on-week.
MSE higher in just 0.9 % of cases, limiting upside pricing.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 92 % cheaper on MSE, 9 % average discount; gap widened 4 ppts WoW.
94 % cheaper (6 % discount) but 4.6 % premium cases—policy inconsistency.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 91.6 % undercutting at ‑8 %, +5 ppts WoW—domestic leakage worsening.
Deeper 11 % discount, plus higher 3.3 % premium share; controls volatile abroad.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 94 % cheaper, 10 % discount; last-minute revenue most at risk.
88 % cheaper, 6 % discount; higher parity (10 %) offers remediation window.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS parity at 76 %, ‑12 ppts MoM; alignment slipping.
13.8 % of fares cheaper, 20 % average discount; +7.5 ppts MoM.
Non-Thai origins show 25 % undercuts—double domestic rate.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: No ‘offer not found’ cases last week.
GDS lower on 13.8 % with ‑20 % gap; up 1.5 ppts WoW.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity 79 %; 11 % undercuts but deepest 26 % discount when they occur.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity 81 %; undercuts 8.6 %, lighter ‑15 % gap; premiums unchanged at 9.9 %.
